title: I Keep Trying to Open up League but i keep getting this message
body: Whenever I try to open up the league launcher, I get the RADS error message saying it couldn't connect to the server and then I need to check my internet connection and my firewall.  However, my internet connection is obviously fine, and I don't have an active firewall.  If by some minute chance league does launch, when I attempt to login I get a message saying the league server did not respond. I have been playing  league at several points throughout my day.  Also, I had just got out of champion selection when my league "crashed" on me. This is very frustrating and none of it is my fault. Btw, I play with an average ping of about 80 to 90.

replies.body: I can launch my game now, but find myself stuck at the login page....WTH
the most disappointing part about it is I don't know what is really happening, roit is not posting any official response to give us an explaination .
I am also having this issue. Tried turning off my firewall as well as restarting and nothing helped.

Sooo on the server status page there is a link to reset your IP address and try again. I just followed the steps and it resolved multiple issues. I run ESET and it hasn't interfered with anything.

The steps are very well explained and not hard to do. Follow them exactly and it should fix the problem. Also if I understand it right it will help clear any clingers to your ipcache  and other potential problem areas.

Great job on that post btw IT Guys.

I don't believe their is any fix right now. I already tried the following things:

* Restart the pc
* Include both lol patcher I, lol patcher (b), client, client admin to the firewall exeptions
* Run the game as admin using the prompt
* Turn off the firewall
* Flush the DNS cache
* Change the DNS settings (to .4 .4 from .8 .8)

I restart, repeat & combine all these actions. I guess it's no lol today.

Why would flushing a DNS solve any issue for you lol.
Thats only if you're getting ddosed/have been ddosed/were disconnected by a ddosed server
Well someone from the staff told us the issue. It's a problem with the IPS I believe. It was no DDoS
Every precaution is worth a shot!
For me it's saying "Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information." I WANT LEAGUE T.T
Same here.

I found a solution!

try do the next thing go to 'finder' > 'League of legends' (click on it) > you drag the lol icon under it 'applications' and than should it work.

Changing the DNS and Alternative DNS to the Google DNS (8.8.8.8 - 8.8.4.4) fix that issue.

On Mac go to Network Advanced, go to the DNS tab and click on the plus (+) icon on the lower left corner, then add the 8.8.8.8, then do it again and type the 8.8.4.4.
 On windows is much easier, Control Panel\Network and Internet\Network Connections, then right click Properties, Internet protocol Verision 4 (TCP/IPv4), properties and change the DNS and Alternative DNS to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 respectively.
 I hope it works for someone.
P.S: Leave a comment if it worked for you.

> [{quoted}](name=Its Spongebob,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=Bx4urHlu,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-01-09T08:00:00.336+0000)
>
> Whenever I try to open up the league launcher, I get the RADS error message saying it couldn't connect to the server and then I need to check my internet connection and my firewall.  However, my internet connection is obviously fine, and I don't have an active firewall.  If by some minute chance league does launch, when I attempt to login I get a message saying the league server did not respond. I have been playing  league at several points throughout my day.  Also, I had just got out of champion selection when my league "crashed" on me. This is very frustrating and none of it is my fault. Btw, I play with an average ping of about 80 to 90.



Try running as administrator.  

(Right click league of legends icon or .exe file, should be a few options down)
I was having the same problem.  Client just started working again. Try it. :)

Exit the game completely

Press the Windows Key or Navigate to the Windows Icon at the bottom left-hand corner.

Type cmd

Right-click the Command prompt shortcut and select "Run as Administrator" from the drop down menu. You should now see a black window with white
letters.

Type ipconfig /release in the command prompt. Then press [Enter]
NOTE: This will disconnect you from the Internet.

Type ipconfig /renew in the command prompt. Then press [Enter]

Type ipconfig /flushdns in the command prompt. Then press [Enter]

Type exit in the command prompt. Then Press [Enter]

Relaunch League of Legends and attempt to reconnect.
All I did was ipconfig/flushdns and it worked. Still can't log in though.
Thanks dude. It helped me, so this is my first time i can say that a NA player had helped me!
